mods.abstract: A RUN AWAY IN JAIL. WAS COMMITTED into the Jail of the Parish of St. Landry, on the 7th of November 1852, a runaway negro calling himself HENRY, and saying he belongs to a certain John H. Harris, residing on Bayou Sal√©, in the Parish of St. Mary, from whome he ranaway about the 20th of October last. Henry is about 35 years old, five feet 6 inches high, of a copper color, and speaks english. The owner is hereby requested to come forward, prove property, pay charges and take him away, otherwise he will be disposed of according to law. CHS. THOMPSON, Jailor. Opelousas 30 Novembre 1852
mods.note: Louisiana Runaway Slave Advertisements, 1836-1865, Louisiana Digital Library, Baton Rouge, La.

recordInfo.recordOrigin: Transformed into MODS from extended Dublin Core by the LDL Development Team at Louisiana State University.
